ai.summary: Food and Farming Trails is a 9.4 km moderately challenging hike in the UK, winding through rural lanes and farmland to reveal local agricultural landscapes and countryside charm.
ai.terrain_summary: The route combines gentle country lanes, grassy field tracks, and farm paths. Expect uneven footing, occasional mud after rain, gates and stiles, and some short road sections. Surfaces are a mix of grass, compacted earth, and a bit of tarmac.
ai.safety_notes: Check the weather before you go and plan for changing conditions in rural areas. Wear sturdy footwear with good grip and bring a waterproof layer. Stay on public rights of way and heed farm gate etiquette; watch for livestock and farm traffic. Keep dogs under control and bring a map or GPS in case of detours. Inform someone of your route and expected finish time in areas with patchy mobile reception.
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March to October) in the UK, with the most pleasant conditions in late spring and early autumn.
